episode_title: 405 - The One With Joey’s New Girlfriend

content.description: Central Perk, the gang’s all there. Ross has a slip of paper that he throws on the ground tying to get Rachel’s attention.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello! What’s this? Oh right its that girl’s phone number. (Rachel ignores him) Yeah-yeah, there it is, just a phone number a really hot girl gave me. (He holds it so that Rachel can see it, she continues to ignore him) It’s no big deal, I mean it is her home phone number, but…(Rachel still ignores him) Whoa! (Throws it in her lap) Whoa-whoops, I almost lost this baby! Yeah, the lovely Amanda gives me her number and I-I go and drop it. (He waves it in front of Rachel’s face. Then suddenly Phoebe has to sneeze and Rachel quickly grabs the slip of paper and gives it to Phoebe for her to sneeze into.)
content.parenthetical: picking up the slip of paper

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you.

content.description: Central Perk, the next morning. Chandler, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: When’s your birthday?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: May fifth, why?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh, I-I’m just making a list of people’s birthdays.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, mine’s December…

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Yeah, whatever. (Walks away)
(Chandler is talking to Monica and notices a beautiful woman.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh, she’s pretty. Pretty ahh, pretty girl, the pretty—she’s pretty.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just go up to her and ask her out. (Chandler laughs) Oh, what’s the worst thing that could happen?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I could die.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it’s-it’s tough being single. That’s why I’m so glad I found Amanda.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you guys went out once. You took your kids to Chucky Cheese , and you didn’t even kiss her.
(Ross glares at Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I tell people secrets. It makes them like me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! (Phoebe sneezes)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! You’re sick, you shouldn’t play. You should just go home, get in bed, and stay there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But I’m unemployed, my music is all I really have now. Well music, and making my own shoes. (She puts her shoe on the table, and it’s horribly decorated) Pretty, huh? (Sneezes)
content.parenthetical: in a nasally voice, from her cold

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, I’m gonna do it! I’m gonna get shot down. Any advice?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just be yourself. But, not too much.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: (softly) Wish me luck.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good luck!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wish it! (To the woman, Kathy, he likes) Hi. Hi, I-I was just sitting over there, and uhh, Chandler. My name is Chandler. Did I say that?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No, you didn’t. Hi, I’m Kathy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh Kathy, with K or a C?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: With a K.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-oh-hey!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Wow! You are really good at this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, come on, give me a break, I’m out on a limb here.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: I’m sorry, you’re right, I apologize, but I should tell you that I’m waiting for a date. (Joey enters) Oh, and there he is now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Hey, hey-hey, hey. (Joey kisses Kathy.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I see you guys already met, huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes-yes, I was just trying to figure out a way to uh, demonstrate how I could get my exceptionally large feet into my even bigger mouth.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Didn’t I tell ya? Always showin’ off.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Before I start, I just wanna say that umm, I have a cold, so if I sneeze in the middle of song, it’s not on purpose. Oh, except the last verse of Pepper People. (Starts to sing) Smelly cat, smelly cat. What are they feeding you? (Stops singing) This chick sounds good. (Singing) Smelly cat, smelly —(stops singing) Hey Gunther, be a good little boy and bring me a whiskey.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is walking into the living room having just gotten up in the middle of the night.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi!
content.parenthetical: sees Kathy is up watching TV

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Jeez, at 2:30 in the morning, I didn’t expect to have to fight over the remote.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: I’m sorry, it’s just this Ernie Cofax thing on in a few minutes I wanted to watch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! That’s why I got up too!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: You’re kidding! Oh, I love him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, listen, I’m sorry about this afternoon, y’know, if I would’ve known you guys were… I never would’ve…

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh please!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So ah, Joey tells me you two met in acting class.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Yeah, they teamed us up as partners. Joey picked three scenes for us to do; all of them had us making out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a good thing actually, because ah, he used to have me rehearse with him.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh-oh-oh-oh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is it on?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No, but this wonder broom is amazing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! (Runs over and gets his wonder broom)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! It’s on! It’s on!
(Chandler jumps into the canoe and sits down. The chick starts chirping and Chandler reaches down to pick him up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There we go little fella.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: What about the duck?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well the duck can swim.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh, jeez. (Hits him)

content.description: Central Perk, the next night, Phoebe is finishing up her set.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My sticky shoes, my sticky-sticky shoes, why do you stick on me, ba-a-by! Thanks for the lights honey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Way to go, Phoebe!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That cold makes you sound so great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s fun, God I love how sexy I am. (Coughs really loudly.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, Kath, we should get going. We’re going to by hamsters.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ooh, that’s great, I love those little guys.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No, no, it’s not like that. I, I work for a medical researcher.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, have fun!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I think it’s great that the medical community is finally trying to help sick hamsters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, I like Kathy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, me too, she’s so cool and pretty.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, she’s…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s smart and funny, y’know? We were up all last night talking, she said the funniest thing about—what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You love her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I don’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, you do. Chandler loves Kathy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, Pheebs lay off him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, he’s a little sensitive right now, `cause he’s so in love.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, umm, oh Kathy! Kathy, I love you! Oh! (She turns around and sees Gunther staring at her and stops suddenly.)
content.parenthetical: turning around and doing that, “I’m making out with someone,” thing with her hands

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, I need to write some depressing stuff to go along with my new floozy voice, but nothing that sad has ever really happened to me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh umm, how about your mom dying, or having to live on the streets when you were 14?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh. Oh, yeah, I could write about the time my hair did that “Woo-hoo” thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So I’m going over to Amanda’s tonight!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel’s not here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How’s it going with her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great, actually. I’m thinking tonight, maybe the night. Yeah, I mean ah, the kids are gonna play together and then when they’re asleep, I’m thinking Amanda and I break open a bottle of wine, and do a little “playing” ourselves.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi guys! This is Josh. Josh, these are my friends, and that’s Ross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, Josh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Josh
content.text: Dudes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, did you play in college? (She points to his NYU Soccer (football for the rest of the world) sweatshirt he’s wearing.)

content.speaker: Josh
content.text: Oh, I still do. Next year, I hope to make varsity though.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, didn’t you ah, play soccer in High School? Oh no wait, that’s right. You just organized their game schedules on your Commodore 64.

content.speaker: Josh
content.text: Well, it’s getting late, I’ve got to get to the game, so I’m gonna… head.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (He starts to leave, and Rachel grabs him and gives him a passionate kiss.) I’ll miss you.

content.speaker: Josh
content.text: Dope! (exits)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, cute one!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Very!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, isn’t he great? It’s so nice to finally be in a fun relationship, y’know? There’s nothing boring about him, and ah, I bet he’s never set foot in a museum.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well maybe he’ll get to go soon, like on a class trip or something.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what else is really great about him, oh, what is the word for the adult that doesn’t have dinosaur toys in their bedroom?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! (He bangs his fists together.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What was that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica knows.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s this dumb thing that Ross made up `cause he was trying to fool our parents. It’s a way of giving the finger, without actually having to give it. I remember I cried the night you made it up, `cause it was the first time that I realized that I was actually cooler than my older brother.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m gonna go get ready, (Gives Monica the fist thing.) for my date tonight, so ah, I’ll just_ head.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I should go to, `cause I’m playing in one hour. Hey, (clears her voice and in her normal voice) you guys should come hear me, ooh hear me. Ooh, (tries to sing) My sticky shoes —eww! Eww! I lost my sexy phlegm!

content.description: Amanda’s apartment, Ross is arriving with Ben.

content.speaker: Amanda
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Amanda
content.text: Hi Ben!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! You-you look great!

content.speaker: Amanda
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! (to her son) Hey Tommy.

content.speaker: Amanda
content.text: I am so glad that you could come over tonight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no-no-no, it’s my pleasure.

content.speaker: Amanda
content.text: Okay, well, my cell phone number is right here on the counter, please help yourself to anything in the fridge.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Amanda
content.text: I appreciate this soo much, I’ve been trying to go out with this guy for like a month.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I-I…

content.speaker: Amanda
content.text: Oh, I don’t mean to be a square, but I’d really appreciate it if you wait and drink your wine after the kids are asleep? Oh uh, thanks for this, I hope I can do the same for you sometime. (She leaves)
content.parenthetical: noticing the bottle of wine he has

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who wants to make some long distance calls?

content.description: A street, Chandler is buying a newspaper and notices Kathy running by.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kathy! Kathy! Hi!! Kathy! Kathy! (She doesn’t hear him and keeps running, Chandler starts chasing her as the theme to The Mod Squad starts to play. First, a car almost hits him and then gets mustard splashed on him as he runs by a hot dog vendor.) Kathy! (He keeps running and gets tangled up in the leashes of five dogs, in desperation he throws his paper.) Fetch! Fetch it! (He frees himself and resumes the chase) Kathy! Kathy! Kathy! (He now trips and falls into a pile of garbage, he tries to get up and scream her name again but he has a piece of spinach in his mouth. He gets out of the garbage and starts crossing the street by running over the hoods of a couple of cabs.) Kathy! (He jumps in front of her and out of breath he says) Kathy.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hey, Chandler! What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I just wanted to say, “Hey!”

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (He walks away disgusted with himself.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is telling Monica about his new baby sitting job.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh come on! You’re making it sound worse than it actually was.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Her date tipped me ten dollars. (Monica laughs)
(Phoebe runs into the kitchen with wet hair, opens the window, and sticks her head outside.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I wanna be sexy again so I’m trying to catch a cold. It should be easy, supposedly they’re pretty common.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you’ll catch pneumonia.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. You were right. I’m in love with Joey’s girlfriend.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, how-how-how is that possible? You barely know her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. I can’t—I just, I can’t get her out of my head. Y’know? I mean, I’m a very bad person. I’m a very, very bad person. I’m a horrible person. (he waits for a reaction, when he doesn’t get one) No you’re not Chandler! We still love you Chandler!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh gosh, Phoebe, I think I caught your cold.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You mean you stole it! (Monica sneezes again) Don’t cover your mouth when you do that!
(Joey and Kathy enter, laughing)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: We were just talking about you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah, I told her about the time you got drunk and fell asleep with your head in the toilet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right in there!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is playing Hide-and-Go-Seek with the chick and the duck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: 99…100! Ready or not, here I come! (He opens his eyes and sees that the chick and the duck are still sitting in front of him) All right, let’s go over the concept one more time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey guys. (to Chandler) Listen uh, you wanna get some dinner with me and Kathy tonight?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh, umm, y’know what, I already ate.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know I had a big meal on Monday, y’know. So that’s just gonna get me straight through the week.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, I see what’s going on here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You-you do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! You don’t like Kathy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you’ve been avoiding her ever since we started going out. Look, I made an effort to like Janice, now I think it’s your turn to make an effort to like Kathy by going out to dinner with us. Right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good, and hey! My treat. (He turns to go into his bedroom then stops.) But that’s only because you’re not eating anything, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is returning from a date with Josh, and when they get the door open, Rachel turns and passionately kisses Josh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross isn’t here.
content.parenthetical: lying on the couch suffering from her cold

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (She tries to walk away from Josh, by he keeps holding her) Stop it!

content.speaker: Josh
content.text: So I’ll see you at the party? Beer’s beer man, 24, 7!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! (Monica gives a sarcastic thumbs up) (Josh leaves) I am soo gonna marry that guy. (looking in her wallet) Ohhh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think he’s stealing from me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because he’s stealing from me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! It’s me. And soup. (to Rachel) Hey, I just saw Josh, he looks so yummy in your leather jacket.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ughh! (Storms out after him)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here, now I don’t eat chicken, so it’s just noodle soup. And there’s no chicken in the broth either, so it’s really just… noodle water.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you so much Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure.
content.parenthetical: picking up Monica’s used Kleenex and putting some in her pocket.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing with those?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But, I need your germs! I want my cold back! I miss my sexy voice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sorry, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s okay. How’s the soup?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm. (nodding her head, “Good.”)
(Monica sets the soup down and Phoebe picks it up and licks the rim.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohhhh!! Gross!!

content.description: A nightclub, Chandler is having dinner with Kathy and Joey.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Ohh, God, guys, check it out, you can see that girl’s underwear!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is she great or what?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: So? Huh? What do you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh, she’s-she’s not really my type.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Not your type?! She’s gorgeous!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what I think it is? It’s the fishnet stockings. Y’know? Whenever I see a girl in fishnet stockings it reminds me of my father in fishnet stockings.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Okay. Understanding a little more why you’re single. Ohh! Y’know, I have a friend you would like, she’s really pretty. And then we could double date!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh, no-no thanks.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Okay, I’ve got some ugly friends, and they’re all available too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, I-I’m gonna grab a beer. (Leaves)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll be right back. (to Chandler) What was that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Kathy was being really nice and you just walked away. I thought we had a deal.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look, what do you want from me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I want you to like her! But if that’s too damned difficult for you, then the least you can do is pretend.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am pretending.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well then, do it better!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, what do you saw I go over there and say how much I like her? (Joey gives him a thumbs up) No-no it’ll be good, I can tell her much I’ve been thinking about her. That I haven’t stopped thinking about her since the moment I met her. That I’m so fantastically, over-the-top, wanna-slit-my-own-throat in love with her, that for every minute of every hour of every day I can’t believe my own damn bad luck that you met her first!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, that’s pretty good. But you might wanna tone it down a little.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! So, uhh, Amanda just-just dropped me off. Yeah, that’s one of the things I love about her, she’s…uh, she’s old enough to drive. (to Monica) So uhh, I guess you’re not going to mom and dad’s tonight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well where’s Amanda?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rach, could you get me some cough drops?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean y’know, I’m thinking. You could bring her, and you guys could go up to your old room, and not make out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, cough drops, please?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: At least I know she’s not going out with me to get into R rated movies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why don’t you just marry her? Oh no, wait a minute you can’t, I’m sorry I forgot, she’s not a lesbian.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You see Amanda and I have a very special…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You have nothing! You’re not even going out! You’re her baby sitter! You have a 12-year-old girl’s job!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, that is soo sad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And what are you laughing at, Miss `My-keg-sucking-boyfriend-is-stealing-from-me!’
(Ross starts laughing)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, so he stole a couple bucks from me! At least he bought me something with it! (Shows her, her ring)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s mine!! Now, would you both please start acting like adults? And get me my cough drops!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here. (Hands her, her cough drops) (to Rachel) At least I made ten bucks in my relationship.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know…
(She does Ross’s little gesture. In response Ross puts his hands behind his neck with his arms sticking straight out and starts flapping them together.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with her guitar.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Platting goats are platting. Platting down the street. Platting goats are platting, leaving little treats . (to Gunther) Does it even work without my sexy voice?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I like it. (sneezes)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Gunther, kiss me.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: What?
(Phoebe grabs Gunther and kisses him. He then falls to the couch in shock.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is watching TV as Joey and Kathy are laughing in Joey’s bedroom. They get to be pretty loud so Chandler turns the TV way up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (Chandler turns down the TV) Now, we’re not actually gonna be sleeping in her, but do you mind?
content.parenthetical: opening the door wearing nothing but a sock, and holding a dart board over the `Little General.’

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, with a blanket draped over her shoulders, opens the door to a similarly clad Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can I sleep on your couch?
(Monica nods `Yes.’ And they both walk to the couch looking all depressed.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing, with everyone else present.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And I’m still waiting for my paper mache man . Thank you my babies.
(applause)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I don’t know if you heard about what happened between me and Phoebe the other day_

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Well, we kissed. I-I-I didn’t initiate the kiss, but-but I also didn’t stop it, and I’ve been feeling guilty.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: So umm, are we cool?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I knew you’d understand.
(Gunther walks away, leaving Rachel with a `What just happened?’ look on her face.)
